Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: An api_management block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_api_management resources be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_api_management resources recover a Soft-Deleted API Management service?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: An app_configuration block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_app_configuration resources be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_app_configuration resources recover a Soft-Deleted App Configuration service?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: An application_insights block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_application_insights resources disable the Azure generated Alert Rule during the creation step?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A cognitive_account block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_cognitive_account resources be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A key_vault block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_key_vault resource be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_key_vault_certificate resource be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_key_vault_key resource be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_key_vault_secret resource be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_key_vault_managed_hardware_security_module resource be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?
Should the azurerm_key_vault_certificate resource recover a Soft-Deleted Certificate?
Should the azurerm_key_vault resource recover a Soft-Deleted Key Vault?
Should the azurerm_key_vault_key resource recover a Soft-Deleted Key?
(Optional) Should the azurerm_key_vault_secret resource recover a Soft-Deleted Secret?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A log_analytics_workspace block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_log_analytics_workspace be permanently deleted (e.g. purged) when destroyed?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A managed_disk block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Specifies whether Managed Disks which can be Expanded without Downtime (on either a Linux VM or a Windows VM) should be expanded without restarting the associated Virtual Machine.

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A resource_group block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_resource_group resource check that there are no Resources within the Resource Group during deletion? This means that all Resources within the Resource Group must be deleted prior to deleting the Resource Group.

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A template_deployment block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_resource_group_template_deployment resource attempt to delete resources that have been provisioned by the ARM Template, when the Resource Group Template Deployment is deleted?

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A virtual_machine block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_linux_virtual_machine and azurerm_windows_virtual_machine resources delete the OS Disk attached to the Virtual Machine when the Virtual Machine is destroyed?
Should the azurerm_linux_virtual_machine and azurerm_windows_virtual_machine request a graceful shutdown when the Virtual Machine is destroyed?

Should the azurerm_linux_virtual_machine and azurerm_windows_virtual_machine skip the shutdown command and Force Delete, this provides the ability to forcefully and immediately delete the VM and detach all sub-resources associated with the virtual machine. This allows those freed resources to be reattached to another VM instance or deleted.

Argument_Reference.Argument_Description: A virtual_machine_scale_set block as defined below.

Child_Arguments.Argument_Description: Should the azurerm_linux_virtual_machine_scale_set and azurerm_windows_virtual_machine_scale_set resources Force Delete, this provides the ability to forcefully and immediately delete the VM and detach all sub-resources associated with the virtual machine. This allows those freed resources to be reattached to another VM instance or deleted.

Should the azurerm_linux_virtual_machine_scale_set and azurerm_windows_virtual_machine_scale_set resources automatically roll the instances in the Scale Set when Required (for example when updating the Sku/Image).
Should the azurerm_linux_virtual_machine_scale_set and azurerm_windows_virtual_machine_scale_set resources scale to 0 instances before deleting the resource.
